forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West southwest wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 2 to 6 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, a muted aura blankets the city, an echo of whispers in the air—the kind that beckons for reflection or simply a quiet stroll. A slight chance of rain lingers in the atmosphere, tapering off as the hour approaches ten, while soft clouds meander leisurely overhead. The temperature dips toward the mid-fifties, and a gentle southwest breeze merely stirs the night, wrapping the city in a tender embrace. 

Sunday promises a continuation of this tranquil demeanor, as clouds once again cast an inviting lid on the sky. Anticipate high temperatures flirting with the low sixties, gradually descending to a cool hug in the afternoon—a perfect excuse to don layers, perhaps a light sweater or a comfortable jacket, while meandering through the streets or perusing the local cafés. The scene, while devoid of dazzling sunshine, invites creativity—an ideal ambiance for a quiet reading nook in your favorite bookstore or an unhurried visit to one of the many art galleries that punctuate the urban landscape. As for the fog, it remains elusive tonight; any marine layer that dared to venture inland has granted the city an uncharacteristically clear view, albeit under a traditional nightly cover, urging you to breathe deeply of this moment, however ordinary it may seem.
